alert.note: Alert for Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 17 at 12:48PM MST until January 18 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...WINTER STORM TO BRING IMPACTFUL SNOW THROUGH WEDNESDAY... .A storm system will bring snow and deteriorating road conditions to northeast Colorado beginning this afternoon in the mountains, and this evening for the urban corridor and plains. Snow will be heavy at times overnight and into early Wednesday morning, then taper off in the afternoon from west to east. Expect difficult overnight travel, with treacherous conditions continuing through Wednesday. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 6 inches, with highest totals farther north. Winds may gust as high as 40 mph at times, resulting in blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...Southern Lincoln County. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 11 AM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org. Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
